features.featureTitle: Update the standalone page (frontend/public/valentine.html) to keep the single-purpose Valentine prompt with “Yes” and an evasive “No” button (moves away on hover/touch), and on “Yes” click reveal: (1) a meme-style cartoon romantic image containing the text “You are my forever, Warda.” and (2) the full love letter content (in English) displayed below the image in a readable, scrollable layout suitable for iPad Chrome.

Update the React app Valentine flow (frontend/src/App.tsx) to match the same end-user behavior as the standalone page: keep the evasive “No” behavior, and after clicking “Yes” show the meme-style cartoon romantic image with the embedded text “You are my forever, Warda.” plus the full English love letter content below the image in a mobile/tablet-friendly layout.

Apply a consistent cartoonish romantic visual theme across both the standalone page and the React flow (warm pink/red palette, playful rounded shapes, heart accents, soft shadows, and a friendly cartoon-like typographic feel), while keeping the UI simple and focused on the single Valentine question and reveal.

Add the generated meme-style image as a static asset under frontend/public/assets/generated and reference it from both frontend/public/valentine.html and frontend/src/App.tsx (do not serve images through the backend).
